Class PlayerState

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.PlayerStates.PlayerState
Direct Known Subclasses:
Accepting, AddCrewState, BaseState, BuildingShip, CheckValidity, ChoosePosition, ChoosingPlanet, ConsumingEnergy, DefendingFromLarge, DefendingFromSmall, GiveAttack, GiveSpeed, HandleCargo, HandleDestruction, HandleTheft, Killing, ReadCardState, Waiting
public abstract class PlayerState extends Object
Represents an abstract state of a player in the game. This class serves as a base for various specific player states, each of which can define distinct behaviors and permissions for allowed commands and actions. Subclasses implement game-specific logic for evaluating commands and creating default actions for their respective states.

    • allows

      public boolean allows(Command command)
      Determines whether the specified command is allowed in the current player state.
      Parameters:
      command - the command to be evaluated for permission
      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed, false otherwise

    • allows

      public boolean allows(AcceptCommand command)
      Determines whether the provided AcceptCommand is allowed in the current context. This method evaluates the AcceptCommand against the specific rules or conditions defined by the PlayerState. The outcome indicates whether the command can be executed or processed in this state.
      Parameters:
      command - the AcceptCommand to be evaluated
      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed in the current player state, false otherwise

      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed, false otherwise

    • allows

      public boolean allows(ConsumeEnergyCommand command)
      Checks whether the specified ConsumeEnergyCommand is allowed in the current player state. This method determines the validity of executing the given ConsumeEnergyCommand based on the rules and conditions defined by the player's state. It serves as a validation mechanism to ensure the command can be executed within the context of the game.
      Parameters:
      command - the ConsumeEnergyCommand to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the ConsumeEnergyCommand is allowed in the current player state, false otherwise

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the specified command is allowed in the current state, otherwise false

      public boolean allows(SelectChunkCommand command)

      Parameters:
      command - the SelectChunkCommand instance to evaluate
      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed in the current PlayerState, false otherwise

    • allows

      public boolean allows(AddCrewAction action)
      Determines whether the specified AddCrewAction is allowed in the current player state. The method checks if the action can be performed based on the player's current state and applicable game rules.
      Parameters:
      action - the AddCrewAction to be evaluated, representing an attempt to add crew members (humans and/or aliens) to a housing unit.
      Returns:
      true if the action is allowed in the current player state; false otherwise.

    • allows

      public boolean allows(AddGoodAction action)
      Determines whether the current state of the player allows executing the given AddGoodAction.
      Parameters:
      action - the AddGoodAction to be checked for permissibility in the current player state
      Returns:
      true if the action is allowed in the current state, false otherwise

    • allows

      public boolean allows(GetEnginePower action)
      Determines if the GetEnginePower action is allowed in the current player state. This method evaluates whether the provided GetEnginePower action can be executed based on the governing rules of the player's current state. It returns a boolean indicating the permissibility of the action.
      Parameters:
      action - the GetEnginePower action to evaluate for allowance. This action aims to calculate and retrieve engine power information during gameplay.
      Returns:
      true if the GetEnginePower action is allowed in the current state, false otherwise.

    • createDefaultCommand

      public abstract Command createDefaultCommand(String gameId, Player player)
      Creates a default command for the given game and player. The specific command generated may depend on the state of the player and the game.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the identifier of the game for which the command is being created
      player - the player for whom the command is being created
      Returns:
      a default instance of a Command appropriate for the given game and player

    • shouldAct

      public void shouldAct(Player player)
      This method resets the player's action state to indicate that the player has not acted.
      Parameters:
      player - the player object whose action state will be reset

    • toClientState

      public abstract PhaseEvent toClientState()
      Converts the current state of the player into a client-ready representation encapsulated within a PhaseEvent object. This method is primarily used to translate the internal state of the PlayerState into a client-facing structure (PhaseEvent) to facilitate communication and interaction in the game architecture. The returned PhaseEvent object represents the specific game phase and contains relevant data necessary for client-side functionalities.
      Returns:
      a PhaseEvent object that represents
